title: Is it true it costs Apple $20 USD to make an iPhone? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. It costs Apple $400 - $600 to manufacturer an iPhone. Wherever you heard that, it is not just wrong — it is probably intentionally spreading a lie.

Absolutely not. The battery alone costs Apple $29, the CPU probably costs several hundred dollars, the display another 100 to 200 dollars and so on. iPhones are the premium phone on the market and are years ahead of any and all Droid phones (including Samsung) and their parts cost more because they deliver performance today that is years ahead of Droid phones.
